Data Structures | Macros | Functions
Button Device Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a hardware abstraction layer for GPIO-based button input devices with support for debouncing, state management, and array-based button handling. It enables reliable button detection, press/release event processing, and power-efficient operation for embedded applications requiring user input capabilities. The driver supports multiple button configurations, customizable pin settings, and features like debouncing and state tracking for optimal user interface performance and system integration.

Key Features

  1. Debouncing: Reliable button press/release detection.
  2. State Management: Track button state and changes.
  3. Array Handling: Support for multiple buttons.
  4. Power Efficiency: Disables pins when not in use.
  5. Customizable Pins: Flexible pin configuration.

Functionality

  • Initialize button(s)
  • Configure pin(s) and debounce logic
  • Track and update button state
  • Support for array-based button management

Usage

  1. Initialize button(s) with am_devices_button_init()
  2. Periodically call am_devices_button_tick() for debounce
  3. Use am_devices_button_array_* functions for multiple buttons

Configuration

  • Configure pin polarity and debounce delay
  • Set up button array and pin configurations

ButtonPolarity

Button polarity macros

#define AM_DEVICES_BUTTON_NORMAL_HIGH   0x1
 
#define AM_DEVICES_BUTTON_NORMAL_LOW   0x0
 

ButtonStateMarcos

Macros for checking button state.

#define am_devices_button_is_up(button)    ((button).bPressed == false)
 
#define am_devices_button_is_down(button)    ((button).bPressed == true)
 
#define am_devices_button_pressed(button)    (((button).bPressed == true) && ((button).bChanged == true))
 
#define am_devices_button_released(button)    (((button).bPressed == false) && ((button).bChanged == true))

void am_devices_button_array_init ( am_devices_button_t * psButtons,
uint32_t ui32NumButtons )

This configures the necessary pins for an array of buttons.

Parameters
psButtonsis an array of button structures.
ui32NumButtonsis the total number of buttons in the array.

This function configures the GPIOs for an array of buttons.

◆ am_devices_button_array_pin_config()

void am_devices_button_array_pin_config ( am_devices_button_pin_cfg_t * psButtonInfo,
uint32_t ui32NumButtons )

Configures the necessary pins for an array of buttons. then this will read, debounce, and disable the button pins.

Parameters
psButtonInfois an array of button pin config structures.
ui32NumButtonsis the total number of buttons in the array.

This function configures the GPIOs for an array of buttons.

void am_devices_button_array_tick ( am_devices_button_t * psButtons,
uint32_t ui32NumButtons )

Configures the necessary pins for an array of buttons. then this will read, debounce, and disable the button pins.

Note
this is the legacy call that uses a default pincfg
Parameters
psButtonsis an array of button structures.
ui32NumButtonsis the total number of buttons in the array.

This function configures the GPIOs for an array of buttons.

Configures the necessary pins for an array of buttons. then this will read, debounce, and disable the button pins.

Parameters
psButtonsis an array of button structures.
am_hal_pingcfgsan array of pincfgs, one for each button
ui32NumButtonsis the total number of buttons in the array.

This function configures the GPIOs for an array of buttons.

void am_devices_button_init ( am_devices_button_t * psButton)

This initializes a button to the default/disabled state.

end ButtonStateMarcos

Parameters
psButtonis a pointer to a button structure.

This function configures disables a button and resets the associated data.

◆ am_devices_button_tick()

void am_devices_button_tick ( am_devices_button_t * psButton)

Configures the pin for a button with a default pincfg then reads and debounces the pin, then disables the button.

Note
this is the legacy call
Parameters
psButtonis an array of button structures.

This function configures the GPIO for a buttons.

Configures the pin for a button with pincfg param and reads and debounces the pin, then disables the button.

Parameters
